H4900.def: = state in which humans are of more than average height{N:001}

H3882.def: = large mythical monster living in the sea and looking like a giant croccodile or similar reptile

H2443.def: = wooden rod about the length of a man, with a metal or bone point with barbs on one end, and a rope on the other end; ► thrown at fish or aquatic animals to kill and catch them

H3956.def: = the fleshy organ in the mouth, used for tasting, licking, swallowing, and (in the case of humans) speaking

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H100.def: = plant with flexible stems, growing in rivers and marshes; ◄ |iScirpus|i*; ► produces much smoke when burning and used for making ropes; ≈ associated with humility

H639.def: = the two external openings in the nose

H5344.def: = causative action by which humans use a sharp object to make a hole through an object

H3895.def: = the lower bony structure of the skull of humans and certain animals that forms the framework of the mouth and holds the teeth

H2336.def: = plant with thorns; ► useless; ≈ regarded as ugly and useless

H8469.def: = to try to win a favorable attitude from someone else; ◄ by approaching that person in a very humble way

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H1696.def: = causative action by which someone exterminates a group of people, either directly or by the hands of someone else

H7390.def: literally: soft of heart; hence: = state in which humans lack courage and decisiveness

H3772.def: = causative action by which humans use a knife or another sharp implement to remove something from a larger object

H1285.def: = a solemn agreement between two or more parties (persons, groups, nations, deities) with stipulations, blessings, and curses

H5650.def: = man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God

H5769.def: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future

H7832.def: = action by which humans give expression to a friendly attitude, joy and amusement with the gestures and sounds that normally accompany it; ≈ this is normally regarded as a good thing, especially when done with restraint, whereas a lack of restraint is often associated with foolishness

H6833.def: = small bird, speckled brown in color; found in abundance around towns and settlements; lives on grass and grain; ◄ Passer domesticus, Passer hispaniolensis, and Passer moabiticus; ► clean and can therefore be eaten

H7194.def: = process by which separate objects being joined together to form one unit

H5291.def: = a young female, ranging from childhood to adulthood; ► often in the service of other people

H2271.def: = person that belongs to a group or class of people

H2673.def: = state in which an object is divided into two or more parts

H996.def: = the area separating two or mores locations

H3669.def: = descendant of {L:Canaan<SDBH:כְּנַעַן>}, son of {L:Ham<SDBH:חָם>}, son of {L:Noah<SDBH:נֹחַ>} and inhabitant of the country named after them

H4390.def: = state or process in which a certain location, container, or surface is filled or covered with so many objects that little or no space is left

H5785.def: = the thin layer of tissue forming the natural outer covering of the body of a person or animal

H7905.def: = wooden rod about the length of a man, with a metal or bone point with barbs on one end, and a rope on the other end; ► thrown at fish or aquatic animals to kill and catch them

H7218.def: = upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities

H1709.def: = collective designation of various cold-blooded, aquatic vertebrates, having gills, usually fins, and typically an elongated body covered with scales; or, in a loosely sense, any of various other aquatic animals; ► an important source of food

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H3709.def: = the inner part of the human {L:hand<SDBH:יָד>}, but with special focus on the activities performed with it, such as holding, covering, or lifting objects, leaning on a staff, clapping, etc.

H4421.def: = armed conflict between different countries or different groups within a country

H3254.def: = action by which humans or deities add to an existing number of entities

H8431.def: literally: waiting; hence: = state in which humans are confident that their longing will be fulfilled

H3576.def: = action by which a human or deity says or reveals something that is not true

H1571.def: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)

H4758.def: = the part of an object that can be seen with the eye

H2904.def: = causative action by which humans throw an object in a certain direction, often with force

6.gl: a man ... his brother > one ... each other

H393.def: = pertaining to being without mercy towards humans and animals

H5782.def: = process by which someone wakes up from his sleep

H4310.def: = a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

H3320.def: = action by which humans or deities take position in a certain place for a specific purpose

H4310.def: = a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

H6923.def: = action by which humans place themselves in front of individuals or groups, facing either forward or backward, ► and either with good or with evil intentions; ≈ sometimes used figuratively in situations where humans come before God in worship, or where God confronts enemies, or when certain conditions are personified

H8064.def: = the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day

H2790.def: = causative action by which someone makes incised marks on a surface of wood or stone with the help of a sharp and hard tool

H907.def: = woven material ◄ made from the stems of the flax plant; absorbs perspiration better than many other types of cloth; ► used for production of clothes; worn by priests and supernatural beings; ≈ associated with quality, strength, and coolness

H1369.def: = the ability to accomplish great things because of characteristics, such as physical strength, power, bravery, skill, wealth, good character, or a combination thereof

H2433.def: = state in which something is physically attractive, ► which may bring about a favorable attitude in others

H4310.def: = a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

H1540.def: = action by which someone takes off his/her clothes, either entirely or in part, ► as a result of which that person becomes naked or improperly dressed, ≈ which is considered a shameful thing to do

H3830.def: = generic designation for any article of clothing

H3718.def: = state in which an object consists of two layers, ► which enhances its strength

H7448.def: = set of ropes or leather straps; ► fitted over the head of a horse and connected to the {L:bit<SDBH:מֶתֶג>}; used to steer the horse

H4310.def: = a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

H6605.def: = process by which objects open up ► in order to give access to something located inside or to create a passage

H1817.def: = a hinged barrier at the entrance to a town, building, or room; ◄ usually made out of wood, but occasionally also out of metal; ► provides or prevents access; ≈ sometimes associated with vulnerability

H367.def: = state of strong fear because of an actual or perceived danger, such as aggression from the enemy, a dangerous animal, or death

H650.def: = river bed that contains water in the rainy season only; ≈ considered as deceptive as one never can never be entirely sure as to whether they contain water or not

H4043.def: = a flat, usually round, object; made of wood or metal; ► used in battle; held by a warrior in front of him as protection from the weapons of his opponent; relatively small and easy to maneuver; ≈ associated with protection and therefore often used as an epithet for God

H1346.def: = state in which a substance increases in volume, which manifests itself in an increasing height

H5462.def: = causative action by which humans or deities close the entrance to a space with the help of a {L:door<SDBH:דֶּלֶת>}

H2368.def: = engraved object; ◄ made out of metal; ► used to make a mark denoting ownership, approval, or closure of something (normally done by pressing into clay or heated wax and usually attached to a document or letter); sometimes worn on a chain around the neck, or in the form of a ring on one's hand; ≈ regarded as valuable and associated with exclusivity

H259.def: = state in which a countable entity is one in number

H5066.def: = state in which objects are close to other objects in space

H7307.def: = an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)

H996.def: = the area separating two or mores locations

8.gl: to be hard as stone (of one's heart) > to not be easily frightened

H1692.def: = state in which objects are closely compacted together

H251.def: = son of one's father, whether from the same mother or not

H3920.def: = action by which humans or animals take control of (other) humans, animals, towns or land, usually with violence

H6504.def: = process by which an object is split up into smaller units

H5846.def: = process by which animals make a sudden involuntary expulsion of air through the nose and mouth caused by the irritation of the nostrils

H1984.def: = process by which an object emits or reflects light; ≈ regarded as awesome

H216.def: = light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked

H6079.def: = the folds of skin ► that cover the eye when closed

H7837.def: = the first appearance of light in the sky in the early morning

H3940.def: = piece of wood burning on one end; ► used to provide light or as a means of igniting something else; ≈ associated with light and destruction

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H784.def: = state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.

H4422.def: = action by which humans move away as fast as possible from a place that is considered insecure ► in order to save their lives

H3318.def: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position

H5156.def: = the two external openings of the nose

H5301.def: = causative action by which humans or deities cause air to flow from their nose or mouth upon an object

H1731.def: = container ◄ made out of woven material such as grass or reeds; ► used for storing and/or carrying objects

H100.def: = plant with flexible stems, growing in rivers and marshes; ◄ |iScirpus|i*; ► produces much smoke when burning and used for making ropes; ≈ associated with humility

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H3857.def: poetic term: = process by which fire gives off flames

H3318.def: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position

H5797.def: = state in which an object is able to withstand force

H1670.def: = state in which people and animals have lost their inner strength and courage

H1750.def: exact meaning unsure; possibly: = to move with speed and great strides

H4651.def: literally: what falls; hence: = those parts of the wheat that have no value and are usually thrown away, such as the husks

H1320.def: = the soft substance in the body of humans and animals that consists of muscle tissue and fat

H1692.def: = state in which objects are closely compacted together

H3332.def: = process by which liquids flow from one place to another

H1077.def: = particle marking a proposition as not true

H4131.def: = state in which an object is not firmly fixed to the surface on which it stands so that it can move or slip; to waver

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H3332.def: = process by which liquids flow from one place to another

H3644.def: = fire; ≈ associated with God's punishment, which is too heavy for humans to bear

H68.def: = hard, heavy, and strong substance, ◄ very commonly found in nature,  ► which can be hewn into different shapes by a craftsman

H6400.def: = a thin, flat piece, cut from a larger portion

H7613.def: = process when part of the human body is raised from a lower position

H410.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H1481.def: = state in which humans live in a place that is not their place of origin or nationality, either permanently or for a substantial period of time

H7667.def: = causative action or process by which humans or deities cause an object to be broken into two or more pieces; ≈ sometimes use figuratively to denote the sudden end of a certain condition or situation

H2719.def: = sharp object; ◄ made out of iron or flint; ► used as tool for various purposes

H5381.def: = action by which humans succeed to catch up with other humans after having pursued them

H1097.def: = particle marking a proposition as not true

H2595.def: = a long, straight rod, usually made of wood, with a sharp {L:iron<SDBH:בַּרְזֶל>} head or point; used for piercing by thrusting; its length varied from the height of a man to much longer

H4551.def: a large pit from which stones are cut

H2803.def: = action by which humans exercise their {L:mind<SDBH:לֵב>} with regard to something

H1270.def: = a strong, hard magnetic silvery-grey metal, ► used in construction and manufacturing; ≈ associated with strength and permanence

H8401.def: = dried stalks of grain and grasses, usually left over from harvesting grain ► used as food for animals or as an ingredient for making clay bricks; ≈ associated with something of little value

H5154.def: = a yellowish-brown alloy of copper with up to one-third tin, ≈ regarded as a hard and difficult to bend

H7539.def: = a natural process by which certain objects slowly degenerate until they disappear; ≈ associated with weakness

H6086.def: = any kind of tall, woody plant that grows from a single trunk and with several lateral branches that often bear leaves and fruit

H7198.def: = a strong but flexible piece of wood to which a string is attached for the firing of arrows, ► used for hunting or as weapon of war

H1272.def: = action by which humans move to another place in haste, ► in order to escape from a dangerous situation

H68.def: = hard, heavy, and strong substance, ◄ very commonly found in nature,  ► which can be hewn into different shapes by a craftsman

H7050.def: = weapon consisting of two strings with a {L:pouch<SDBH:כַּף>} in the middle;◄ made of leather; ► a {L:stone<SDBH:אֶבֶן>} is placed in the pouch, the sling is twirled and one string released to propel the stone; used to hunt or to chase away wild animals, or to attack an enemy

H2015.def: = action by which humans turn their body around in order to face a different direction than before

H7179.def: = dry grass-like remnant of wheat or another grain crop following the harvest; this term possibly refers to two kinds of material, one being the remnant of the crop remaining in the ground, the other being the unwanted residue of stalks; ► only used for brick making; ≈ usually considered of little value and needing to be separated from the grain itself; maybe burned

H8455.def: = a short wooden rod used for hunting

H2803.def: = action by which humans exercise their {L:mind<SDBH:לֵב>} with regard to something

H7179.def: = dry grass-like remnant of wheat or another grain crop following the harvest; this term possibly refers to two kinds of material, one being the remnant of the crop remaining in the ground, the other being the unwanted residue of stalks; ► only used for brick making; ≈ usually considered of little value and needing to be separated from the grain itself; maybe burned

H7832.def: = action by which humans give expression to a friendly attitude, joy and amusement with the gestures and sounds that normally accompany it; ≈ this is normally regarded as a good thing, especially when done with restraint, whereas a lack of restraint is often associated with foolishness

H3591.def: = a type of short {L:spear<SDBH:רֹמַח>} or large {L:arrow<SDBH:חֵץ>}, made of wood or reed, and therefore relatively light and more suited for throwing from a standing position or while riding on a horse or in a chariot

H2789.def: = container ◄ made of baked clay; ► used for household activities, in sacrificial rituals, and for the storage of documents; ≈ regarded as of low value

H2916.def: = wet soil;◄ moistened by rain or because of its proximity to a body of water; ► can be used for pottery or bricks; ≈ regarded as cheap, easily obtainable and workable material for making basic items; otherwise as a valueless substance or an obstacle for movement

H4688.def: = a very low area of the earth

H7570.def: = causative action by which humans bring water to a temperature in which it starts bubbling

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H3220.def: = a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water

H4841.def: = spices that enhance the taste of food

H215.def: = process by which something reflects light; ≈ associated with well-being

H310.def: = the side or part of something away from the spectator or from the direction in which it moves or faces

H2803.def: = action by which humans exercise their {L:mind<SDBH:לֵב>} with regard to something

H8415.def: = great body of water located around and under the surface of the earth; when the world was newly created this water used to cover the earth as well; the subterranean water comes up to the surface of the earth through springs

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H6083.def: = the loose natural substance of the earth's surface

H4915.def: = something that is similar in shape or character to something else

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H1097.def: = particle marking a proposition as not true

H2844.def: = state of being broken or destroyed; ≈ associated with hardship

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H1364.def: = state in which a person or object is of great or more than average height; ≈ associated with status

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation
